tool.name: Raw Tools
tool.description: Perform scan data parsing, quantification and quality control analysis of Thermo Orbitrap raw mass spectrometer files.
tool.command:
#from datetime import datetime #import json #import os #set $exp_str = "Galaxy_Experiment_%s" % datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d%H%M%s") #set $samp_str = "Sample_%s" % datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d%H%M%s") #set $temp_stderr = "pathwaym_stderr" #set $bin_dir = "bin"
mkdir output; cwd=`pwd`; export HOME=\$cwd;
ln -s '$input_raw' input.raw &&
##################### ## Raw Tools ## ##################### (rawtools
## PARSING AND QUANTIFICATION OPTIONS
## If any processing option is enabled in parsing & quantification, "parse" command is mandatory #if $parsing_quantification_options.processing_conditional.matrix_boolean OR $parsing_quantification_options.chromatogram_conditional.chromatogram_boolean OR $parsing_quantification_options.mgf_conditional.mgf_boolean OR $parsing_quantification_options.metrics_boolean: parse
--files \$cwd/input.raw
## Generates Matrix file #if $parsing_quantification_options.parsing_quantification_conditional.matrix_boolean: --parse #end if
## Generates quantification information #if $parsing_quantification_options.parsing_quantification_conditional.quantification_boolean: --quant --labelingreagent ${parsing_quantification_options.parsing_quantification_conditional.quantification_conditional.quantification_labeling_reagent} #end if
## Unlabeled quant #if $parsing_quantification_options.parsing_quantification_conditional.unlabeledquant_boolean: --unlabeledquant #end if
## Generates Mgf file #if $parsing_quantification_options.mgf_conditional.mgf_boolean: --writemgf --masscutoff ${parsing_quantification_options.mgf_conditional.mgf_masscutoff} ## DEPRECATED --intensitycutoff ${parsing_quantification_options.mgf_conditional.mgf_intensitycutoff} #end if
## Generates chromatogram file #if $parsing_quantification_options.chromatogram_boolean: --chro ${parsing_quantification_options.chromatogram_conditional.chromatogram_type}${parsing_quantification_options.chromatogram_conditional.chromatogram_order} #end if
## Generates metrics file #if $parsing_quantification_options.metrics_boolean: --metrics #end if
--out \$cwd
2>> $temp_stderr);
## TODO: AS WE NEED FIXED NAMES FOR THE OUTPUTS, WE NEED TO RENAME THEM
exit_code_for_galaxy=\$?; cat $temp_stderr 2>&1; (exit \$exit_code_for_galaxy)

param.name: input_raw
param.label: Raw file
param.help: Select the raw file from history

param.name: matrix_boolean
param.label: Create Matrix file
param.help: Parses raw file meta and scan data and creates a tab-delimited text file.

param.name: quantification_boolean
param.label: Quantification
param.help: Also quantifies reporter ions and write results to output matrix.

param.name: unlabeledquant_boolean
param.label: Unlabeled quant
param.help: Calculate areas of precursor peaks and writes them to the matrix file as ParentPeakArea column.

param.name: mgf_masscutoff
param.label: Mass cutoff
param.help: Specify a mass cutoff to be applied when generating MGF files. May be of use if removal of reporter ions is desired prior to searching of MS2 spectra.

param.name: chromatogram_boolean
param.label: Create chromatogram
param.help: Creates a text file of chromatographic data for investigation or plotting.

param.name: metrics_boolean
param.label: Create metrics
param.help: Creates a text file containing general metrics about the Ms run.

tool.help:
**What it does**
RawTools is an open-source and freely available package designed to perform scan data parsing and quantification, and quality control analysis (to be developed in further versions) of Thermo Orbitrap raw mass spectrometer files.
RawTools is written in C# and uses the Thermo RawFileReader library. RawTools is the replacement for RawQuant Python package.
https://github.com/kevinkovalchik/RawTools
